German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Arbeit +‎ -s- +‎ -los.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈaʁbaɪ̯tsloːs/
  • Audio
    		(file)
  • Hyphenation: ar‧beits‧los

Adjective[edit]

arbeitslos (not comparable)

  1. (general) unemployed (having no work despite being willing to work)
  2. (colloquial) on welfare; unemployed; idle (having no work and being supported by social benefits despite being able to work)
  3. (law, Germany) working less than 15 hours a week, actively looking for a job that is subject to obligatory social-security payments, registered at the national employment agency, and responding to the latter’s placement services

  • stellenlos
  • stellungslos
